* The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the environment.
* Traditional methods of cooling cooked meat products using chilled air cause dehydration, while newer methods use brine solution for quicker heat transfer.
* Overhead rail systems have limitations in transferring meat products, while wheeled floor trucks are more versatile but can contaminate the brine solution.
* The enclosed floor track system prevents contamination by segregating the wheels of the hand trucks from the treatment fluid.
* Two embodiments of the system are described, one for horizontally axled hand trucks and another for trucks with downwardly depending struts.
* The system allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving resources and providing an economic advantage. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools, allowing for easy removal without the use of a drill bit.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and retriever section, allowing for vertical movement and rotation to engage with wear bushings.
* The retriever section has protruding members for engaging with wear bushings or a threaded end for threaded engagement.
* The design prevents damage to the wear bushing or the apparatus due to excessive weight, providing a simple and efficient retrieval process.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a downhole vibratory tool that allows wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage that can be closed by landing a plug on a seat.
• The tool features modular stacked pistons to increase power delivery to the stuck object, as well as an annular dump valve design to prevent slamming against a seat during operation.
• By dropping a plug into the passage, the tool can be activated without the need for complex components, allowing for longer trouble-free service.
• The design eliminates cyclical impacts on valve components, extends the life of the spring, and allows for operation with or without impacts on each cycle.
• The tool can be used for fishing operations, stimulation, or tubing string vibrations, providing large amplitude oscillating forces with a single valve for operation. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method for constructing precast concrete retaining walls with integral counterforts, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases. The face panel and counterfort are precast and connected to a precast base using grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring during installation. The base can be stabilized with textured surfaces, shims, flowable grout, or H-piles driven into the ground for added stability.
• The retaining wall can also include a cast-in-place vehicle impact barrier on top of the wall or behind the face panel. The impact barrier can be precast and integrated with the face panel at the factory, eliminating the need for in situ casting. The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting rebar from one module into openings in the other module and sealing the connection with grout, providing a secure and stable structure. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for delivering heat at the down hole end of production tubing of oil or gas wells to improve production by addressing issues such as high oil viscosity, paraffin blockage, and iron oxide buildup.
• The down hole heating system focuses heat on the production zone to promote flow, contains heat to prevent loss, and protects electrical components from damage caused by down hole fluids, resulting in increased flow rates and extended system reliability.
• The system includes components such as electrical resistance heater rods, heat insulating packers, stainless steel collars, and shielded electrical connections, providing an effective method for heat treating oil and gas wells to improve flow rates and address long-standing production challenges.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with an adjustable central vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency.
• Prior art devices lacked the ability to adjust suction pressure during cleaning operations.
• The present invention allows for real-time regulation of suction by adjusting the spacing between the suction head and the pool bottom.
• Adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the vacuum head for easy operation without tools.
• The apparatus enables precise regulation of suction without adjusting the suction source.
• Adjustment mechanisms can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minor changes.
• The device includes outboard and inboard roller assemblies for adjusting the platform's height above the pool bottom.
• A specially configured frame member allows for adjusting the central suction portion of the platform.
• The invention can be provided in kit form for retrofitting existing pool cleaning devices.
• The adjustable pool vacuum head provides a simple, cost-effective, and easy-to-use solution for regulating suction during pool cleaning operations.
</summary>

<summary>
• Example embodiment relates to modular composed stave floors with improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
• Method involves providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, assembled with multidirectional holding means.
• Multidirectional holding means include dendrites, glue, and clamps to prevent displacement or dimensional changes, resulting in increased durability and ease of corrective maintenance for the floors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladder attachments that provide lateral stability, prevent defacing of work surfaces, and resist sliding or slipping.
* Traditional ladders can damage work surfaces, lack stability on corners, and have limited contact area with the work surface.
* The attachment includes a brace with a large contact area, a U-bolt securing the brace to the ladder rung, and a resilient pad for gripping the work surface.
* The attachment can be adjusted for different ladder sizes, allows the ladder to straddle corners, and improves overall stability and safety during use.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, especially those that are stuck or lost.
* It includes a pull tool with a locking mechanism for effective connection and disconnection from objects in the well bore.
* The mechanism can be used for wire line operations and is adaptable for various down hole service operations.
* It features an external overshot or internal spear structure with telescoping inner and outer bodies.
* A catch mechanism with pin structures and control springs allows for easy locking and unlocking of the tool.
* The tool can be used for fishing operations in well bores with corroded or eroded fishing necks.
* The mechanism provides a simple and efficient way to establish and release connections with down hole objects.
* It eliminates the need for jarring or mechanical shocks to disconnect the tool from the object.
* The invention offers a reliable and versatile solution for down hole tool installation and retrieval operations in wells.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants in artifacts and machines like automobiles, trains, ships, and aircraft.
• The nozzle has a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button for precise sealant application.
• It can be used manually with cartridges or with automated injection machines.
• The design allows for encapsulation of rivets and nuts for optimal sealing.
• The injection button has channels and orifices for accurate sealant dispersion.
• The design simplifies sealing work, reduces application time, and improves the quality of the sealant application.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to sensors for monitoring position and motion of objects in mechanical systems.
* The sensors are designed to reduce the number of wires required for operation, using only two wires for power and signal transmission.
* A waveform generator and error correction generator work together to modify the sensing signal and provide a conditioned sensing signal to the monitoring system.
* The error correction generator eliminates static signals and error signals that do not provide information about the object's position.
* A closed-loop compensation circuit constantly compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal to maintain accuracy.
* A window reference circuit compares the ideal sensor output to the existing output and adjusts it if necessary.
* The sensor system is designed to draw minimal current upon startup and can be recalibrated easily.
* The sensor modulates current across two wires connected to the monitoring system, converting it into a voltage signal.
* The system is capable of rapid recalibration in response to sudden changes in system parameters.
* The invention allows for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy consumption. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, specifically for intake and exhaust functions.
* The system eliminates the need for springs and allows for infinitely variable valve displacement.
* The system controls valve timing and opening/closing with precision and efficiency.
* It can be computer-controlled to optimize engine performance and fuel consumption.
* The system can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder.
* The design is simple, robust, and more efficient than traditional cam-spring systems.
* The system allows for individual control of each valve, enhancing engine performance.
* The invention offers significant improvements in power delivery and fuel efficiency for internal combustion engines.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs and includes a housing with lighting control regions for white and blue light.
• The light member includes modules with LEDs emitting white or blue light, controlled by switches on the housing.
• Modules are easily coupled to the lighting control region and have electrical connectors for power supply.
• Some modules include RF communication for remote control, while others have timers for setting on/off times and dimming.
• The light member can be used under cabinets with a bracket for mounting and can be linked together for a series of lights.
• Optics elements can be added to the light member to change the angle or focus of the emitted light. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, reducing debris generation and increasing holding power in the substrate.
• The collation system includes a collar portion that captures the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent collars. Various configurations, such as tapered collars, embossed patterns, and preferentially weakened regions, are used to influence separation of the connecting portions at desired locations to minimize debris. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, aiming to simplify production, improve cooling efficiency, and reduce thermal stresses.
* The apparatus includes separate inserts, such as straight or U-shaped separating walls, which are inserted into a hollow casting and secured with holders, rails, or integral material joints.
* By using inserts instead of cast separating walls, advantages include reduced material in transitional regions, minimized thermal stresses, and easier adjustment of the cooling system.
* The invention is particularly beneficial for gas turbine blades, allowing for simpler assembly, reduced weight, and improved cooling efficiency, especially in high-speed rotating blades. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a system and method for controlling fuel delivery systems in vehicles, allowing for automatic or manual control without causing lurching or stalling.
• The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to set the throttle position for optimal performance, and can smoothly switch between automatic and manual control.
• By using a stepper motor or DC motor, the system ensures smooth transitions between control modes, providing full vehicle operation even in manual mode.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste, aiming to reduce pollution emissions.
• The waste fuel burner operates by forming a conical pile of waste fuel fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel.
• The burner uses primary and secondary combustion chambers with controlled air intake to maintain low temperatures, efficient combustion, and minimal particulate emissions, providing a clean and efficient alternative to traditional hog fuel burners.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to evaporative refrigeration in the field of air conditioning, focusing on cooling air without adding water vapor.
* The system uses a heat exchanger to separate evaporating water from the cooling air stream, achieving sensible cooling without increasing moisture content.
* By recirculating return air from the load as working air on the wet side of the heat exchanger, the system operates more efficiently.
* A hybrid system is also described, where a portion of the cooled air stream is further cooled by heat exchange with the evaporator of a vapor compression refrigeration unit, achieving dehumidification and increased efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing the number of components and improving engine robustness.
• The engine includes a modular system with hydraulic engine brakes connected to a portion of the cylinders, activated during the compression stroke to provide engine braking horsepower as needed.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump described has two or more pump heads arranged in series to pump fluid from a reservoir.
* Each pump head has an impeller driven by a common drive structure passing through the pump heads.
* The pump heads have combiners to combine fluid flow from multiple conduits into a single flow.
* The pump can be mounted on a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer for use in various applications.
* The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance by allowing for the insertion of additional pump heads in the series.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a small, lightweight point cap system with adjustable weight for perfect arrow balance, as well as a balance pin for arrow shaft balancing.
* The invention also includes point adaptors for attaching arrow points and nock caps for attaching nocks to arrow shafts, all designed to prevent dirt from entering the shaft and to improve overall arrow performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training in the military.
• It provides a cost-effective and realistic simulation of small arms fire without modifying the weapon, using plastic expendables with pyrotechnic charges.
• The simulator includes an electrical control circuit with various components like bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, and firing control.
• The plastic expendable contains pyrotechnic charges sealed in cups, ignited by a bridge wire to produce sound and flash simulating small arms fire.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure like an auxiliary gearbox for aircraft gas turbine engines.
• Extreme loads, such as blade-off events, can cause damage to gearboxes and peripheral systems, leading to potential oil leakages.
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and dampen translation.
• The gearbox assembly includes driveshaft connections, peripheral load connections, a seal, and mounting links to secure the gearbox to the engine.
• The mounting link consists of a female link, a male link, and a pin that selectively retains the links and allows translation after extreme loads.
• The pin serves as a fusible link that shears at a known load magnitude to prevent damage to the gearbox and attached peripherals.
• The radial interface between the female and male links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation.
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping eliminates the need for all linkages to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that utilizes dynamic effects of air flow to improve engine performance and reduce noise.
• The device includes a tank, two pipes of different sizes interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a valve actuated based on engine load conditions to optimize engine performance and minimize noise levels.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or equipment to poles, flat surfaces, or other structures.
• It allows for easy installation by one person and can be used on surfaces of different sizes.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket for mounting the object.
• The system uses minimal components for economic and time efficiency during installation.
• The brackets can be used for mounting loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, and video cameras. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosed concepts provide an efficient, clean burning burner with a system for attaching modular heat utilizing appliances.
• The burner includes a combustion chamber with secondary and tertiary combustion air flow paths, a pivotally coupled ash pan, and a cover to prevent ingress of objects and exposure to heat.
• The burner also features manual couplings for attaching modular heat utilizing appliances such as closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a method of using control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance during turbine control valve testing.
* By maintaining total mass flow through parallel valves constant, steam boiler pressure and turbine power changes are minimized during testing.
* The method involves compensating for flow changes by adjusting the flow through remaining control valves when one valve is closed for testing.
* Testing of the method showed a significant reduction in pressure excursions during turbine control valve testing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on improving fuel economy and durability of rotary internal combustion engines by addressing cooling issues, particularly around spark plugs, to prevent structural failures.
* The design includes staggered spark plug bosses in the cooling passageway of the rotor housing to enhance coolant flow and heat transfer, reducing the risk of thermal distortion and failure.
* By offsetting the spark plug terminals and arranging the bosses asymmetrically, the invention promotes efficient combustion and cooling, leading to a significant increase in the heat transfer coefficient in the critical spark plug boss zone.
</summary>

<summary>
• Electronic components produce heat during operation, requiring cooling to prevent overheating and premature failure.
• Cooling fans are commonly used to move air across electronic components for effective cooling.
• A new system eliminates the need for fasteners to secure cooling fans to enclosures, reducing costs.
• The system includes a motor, mounting legs with resilient portions, and spring members to securely attach the fan to a panel.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically designed for an aircraft cleaning apparatus.
* The valve allows for a solution ranging from 0% to 100% of each fluid source, providing continuous adjustment of the mixture strength.
* The valve body includes passages for soap solution and water inlets, an outlet passage for the mixture, and a valve mechanism for directing the fluids.
* A spool valve assembly is used within the valve body, with a flow restricting device to control the flow rate of each fluid.
* The valve system allows for multiple users to control the strength of the cleaning solution without disrupting each other.
* By rotating the valve handle, users can adjust the proportion of soap solution and water in the mixture.
* The design ensures constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages, allowing for smooth operation of multiple valve systems from common fluid sources.
* The invention provides a stand-alone cleaning apparatus with analog control over the mixture, suitable for various cleaning tasks in the commercial airline industry.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas, by compressing gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and feeding it back to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature and increased exit pressure.
• Natural gas is transported over long distances in large pipelines, requiring compressor stations to increase gas pressure back to nominal levels. In permanent frost areas, cooling the gas is necessary to prevent ground thawing and pipe ruptures.
• Conventional cooling methods using re-cooling plants with propane as a cooling agent are expensive and pose safety risks. The present invention offers a method to reduce investments and operational risks by compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure.
• By utilizing expansion for cooling, the method reduces the need for re-cooling plants and provides a more efficient and cost-effective solution for compressor stations in both warm and cold weather conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a large size clutch unit for aircraft catapult systems, utilizing interleaved clutch plates and discs with separate piston and cylinder means for each set.
* The clutch unit features a servo control valve, first and second stage fluid amplifiers, and a unique cooling system for the clutch discs.
* The design allows for easy removal and replacement of individual clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire unit.
* The clutch unit minimizes residual drag by using centrifugal force of oil for retraction, providing maximum torque transmission and control accuracy.
</summary>

<summary>
* Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials, but lack inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise functionality.
* Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration, resulting in high energy disturbances to mounted instruments during flight.
* The present invention introduces novel damping features into kinematic mounts to dissipate vibration energy and protect instruments from damaging flight loads.
* Two preferred embodiments of the invention involve spherical and cylindrical slot dampers placed at flexural hinge locations in the mounts.
* The damping mechanisms introduce viscoelastic materials that dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat, significantly increasing damping levels.
* The design modifications preserve strength, stiffness, and kinematic features of the mounts while reducing high energy disturbances to mounted instruments.
* The damped kinematic mounts use six identical strut elements to reduce manufacturing complexity and costs.
* The mounts are arranged to uncouple suspension modes, providing stability and support to instruments during launch and minimizing loads transmitted to the instruments.
* The invention offers a simple and efficient solution to protect precision instruments from vibration-induced damage during space missions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention involves a system of combustion and expansion cylinders in a cascading configuration to maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction and reduce exhaust emissions.
* Water injection is used to expand exhaust gases and create steam for additional drive, with a water recovery system to recycle water and eliminate the need for a radiator.
* Catalytic materials are used on surfaces exposed to hot exhaust gases to achieve catalytic conversion within the engine itself, reducing emissions and improving efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present application is a continuation of a patent application for a SCADA system for energy extracting vessel navigation.
• The invention addresses the need for a remote control system for mobile structures to recover energy from severe weather patterns.
• The system includes computer servers gathering data from various sources like GPS, weather satellites, and weather data disseminating entities.
• The system optimizes efficiency by using an algorithm that accounts for weather observations, sensor data, and vessel performance models.
• The GUI allows human operators to interact with the system, adjust navigation plans, monitor vessel performance, and choose optimal paths based on weather data.
• The system also includes electromechanical circuits for controlling mechanisms affecting the position and velocity of the mobile structure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for fabricating steel plates with a precoat, where a portion of the metal alloy layer is removed at the periphery to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas during welding.
* By removing the metal alloy layer, the welded joints have good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
* Different methods of removing the metal alloy layer, such as brushing or laser ablation, were compared to traditional methods without removal.
* The method of the invention showed no intermetallic areas in the welded joints, resulting in improved ductility and corrosion resistance in the fabricated parts. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Methods and systems are provided for obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates of customer service locations using a GPS system, updating databases with this information, and generating driving directions between service locations for technicians.
* The system includes an input device for technicians, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, a customer records system, and a mapping system, all working together to enhance customer service response time and efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields includes two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit to protect an object from interfering fields.
* The control unit processes the signals from the sensors to create virtual sensor signals, which are then used in independent control loops to generate control signals for the coils.
* In cases where two compensation systems are used in close proximity, a feedback matrix is introduced to account for feedback effects between the systems and adjust the control signals accordingly.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage made from at least one ring element and multiple guide structures for rolling bodies.
* The cage is produced by joining flat material ring segments in succession and welding them together before forming the axial profiling.
* This method reduces cutting waste and production costs, especially for cages with an internal diameter over 140 mm.
* The flat material ring segments are welded along edge regions to form engagement zones with joint contours that positively interlock.
* The ring segments are punched out from sheet metal material and formed as 120° segments, requiring only three weld points for joining.
* The concept is suitable for radial and axial bearing cages, with mirror-symmetry ring elements offsetting weld points in the circumferential direction.
* The method involves laser welding or pressure welding the ring segments, with the possibility of forming material beads for high-quality weld connections.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy.
• The method involves sensing a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
• Bioorthogonal reactions are used to furnish at least one resonance site in the sample.
• The bioorthogonal reactions introduce resonance sites not inherently present in the sample.
• Specific bioorthogonal reactions like Staudinger ligation can be used in the method.
• The method allows for selective tagging of structures for improved visualization in CARS microscopy.
• By introducing resonance sites, the method increases the sensitivity and specificity of CARS microscopy.
• The method can be used to highlight structures not detectable by conventional CARS methods.
• Bioorthogonal reactions provide a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in CARS microscopy.
• The combination of bioorthogonal reactions and CARS microscopy allows for targeted detection of specific structures in biological samples. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to apparatus for executing floating point operations in data processing systems.
• Floating point operations involve aligning fractions before addition or subtraction, which can be time-consuming.
• The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in floating point units.
• By determining the difference between subsets of operand exponent arguments, the subtraction process can be initiated earlier.
• Different procedures are used based on the subset differences to optimize the computation of the final fraction result.
• The apparatus includes logic units for detecting subset differences and selecting the appropriate procedures for faster execution.
• Acceleration is achieved by starting the subtraction process before the complete operand exponent arguments are determined.
• The final fraction result is calculated efficiently based on the subset differences and the complete operand exponent arguments.
• The invention allows for quicker execution of floating point operations by utilizing subset differences in operand exponent arguments.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from different sources, comparing them to identify missing and extra volume elements.
• The system allows for the evaluation of segmentations from experienced clinicians, trainees, or different software systems.
• A metric method is used to measure the conformance between segmentations based on missing and extra volume elements.
• The metric method can be customized by the user, with parameters for weighting volume elements based on distance.
• Voxel models are created from the segmentations for comparison, adjusting for any origin offsets.
• The comparison results are displayed in an analysis window, showing common, missing, and extra volume elements in different colors.
• A quantitative evaluation is provided, including primary and secondary volumes, missing and extra volumes, and the metric method score.
• A histogram table tallies the voxels of missing and extra volumes based on distance measurements.
• The system can be used for training clinicians, quality assurance of auto-segmentation routines, and assessing new treatment plans.
• The output of the system can also be used to assess changes in internal anatomy during radiation therapy and guide treatment planning.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method of tracking specimens collected from patients in a medical facility, utilizing unique machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, order forms, specimen containers, and blood drawer badges to ensure accurate specimen collection and processing.
• The system involves storing patient information, order details, and barcode numbers in a relational database structure in a computer storage, allowing for real-time verification of patient identity, specimen collection, and timely processing of specimens, reducing errors and improving efficiency in the specimen collection process.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device, primarily designed for golfers, utilizing GPS technology and voice recognition to provide distance and other information in a verbal form.
• The device is incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat, and includes features like bone conductance vibration sensors, Bluetooth technology, and the ability to record and share geographic coordinates of golf courses.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a system and method for accurately checking design rules for different types of circuits, such as memory and logic, in an integrated circuit design.
* The system creates customized design rules based on modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of specific regions in the chip, eliminating false errors and pinpointing real design rule errors.
* Different types of memory regions are identified and checked against appropriate memory rules, ensuring that each region is subject to the correct set of design rules.
* The invention improves the design verification process in the semiconductor industry by categorizing errors in different regions and streamlining the design development cycle.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
• Thin substrate waveguides are used for controlled illumination, providing high diffraction efficiencies and compact, rugged arrangements.
• The global and local diffraction efficiencies of waveguide holograms are discussed, along with issues like illumination depletion and two-sidedness.
• Solutions to alignment sensitivity, light dispersion, and nonuniform wavefronts are proposed, including a priori and a posteriori compensation methods.
• Various architectures for recording waveguide hologram gratings are described, with experiments showing the quality of reconstructed beams.
• Polarization and phase characteristics of the reconstructed beams are analyzed, with emphasis on depolarization and wavefront distortion.
• Different configurations for recording holograms are used, with experiments showing the efficiency and losses associated with the process.
• The invention is not limited to specific embodiments, allowing for variations in light sources, objects for illumination, and other parameters within the scope of the claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to identify defects in resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew.
• Modern squirrel cage rotors are mass-produced with high quality, but defects like porosity, open circuits, and poor insulation can affect rotor performance.
• Prior art methods for testing rotors include using stator cores, destructive testing techniques, and oscilloscope waveform analysis.
• The novel method and apparatus provide non-destructive testing of rotors, measuring resistance, reactance, and effective skew for defect identification.
• The test apparatus includes test heads with exciting means, voltage sensing, current sensing, and processing means for data analysis.
• The data processor calculates resistance, reactance, and effective skew values from sampled data, while the control processor determines pass/fail based on preset thresholds.
• Statistical information is stored for analysis over multiple tests, and results are displayed on a terminal and can be printed for record-keeping.
• The test fixture includes a retractable spindle with a clutch mechanism to securely hold the rotor during rotation for accurate testing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The document describes a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources to managed libraries with validated digital certificates, while denying access to managed applications without proper authorization.
* The process involves verifying managed metadata to ensure type-safe code, authorizing requests to access native resources through managed libraries, and using a runtime host to access the native system resources.
* Additionally, the document outlines procedures for validating digital signatures, executing trusted components, and transmitting digitally signed containers to mobile devices for secure execution of applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies, such as DRAM technology, to reduce manufacturing costs and complexity.
• EPROM devices are used for DRAM redundancy circuits, offering programmable repair mechanisms that are more cost-effective and efficient than current fuse-based methods.
• Another type of EPROM device, called SEPROM, utilizes transistor stress effects to store data, providing a versatile and secure option for embedded applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a memory, specifically in functional memories where updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating.
* The method involves maintaining a queue using a tree-shaped structure where additions are directed to non-full nodes on the edge of the structure and deletions are directed to leaf nodes.
* A header node is added to the structure in a preferred embodiment, allowing for faster and more space-efficient updates by indicating the end and beginning of the queue and enabling inversion of the queue in constant time and space.
* The memory arrangement includes an actual memory, intermediate registers for storing queue nodes, control logic for managing the queue, and input/output registers for record pointers, providing a systematic approach to maintaining the FIFO queue. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between protective layers.
* Smart cards with IC chips are known for credit card transactions, either with contacts or contactless antennas.
* Prior art smart cards used rigid cores and glue or mechanical means to secure components, leading to potential damage and increased production costs.
* The new card design uses shock-absorbing layers with indicia, encased in rigid outer layers for protection.
* The core layer is made of silica-filled polyolefin, with an antenna and chip fixed to it, enveloped by a bottom sheet.
* An alkyd resin spid with an anti-binding agent is printed on the core layer, and laminate layers are attached to encase the core and bottom sheet.
* The process involves pre-shrinking the core layer, printing indicia, bonding the layers with adhesives, and laminating with polymer layers.
* The identification card can be personalized with dye diffusion thermal transfer printing or inkjet printing.
* The protective layer is added to prevent damage and bleeding of dye, with additional security features for tamper-proofing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to determining the optimum value of feedback gain for feedback control systems quickly and accurately.
* The method involves provisionally determining feedback gain, executing feedback control, calculating evaluation values, and adjusting feedback gain values.
* Evaluation functions are used to assess the stability, accuracy, and response of the control system to determine the optimal values of the P, I, and D gains.
* The method can be applied to automatic guidance vehicles, with feedback gains determined either during continuous running or at specific course sections.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles in a detector.
* Charge pulses are generated in the detector when a particle passes through, and signals are subsequently converted and indicated.
* The method allows for detection of individual particles and integration of signals without knowing the expected count rates.
* The signals are separated based on rate, with amplification in fast and slow amplifiers depending on the signal rate.
* Detector material can be doped with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
* Materials enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, like diamond, are used for detectors.
* The support capacitor compensates for discharging of the detector at high beam rates.
* The method and device can be used in particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices like X-ray and CT scanners.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range.
* There is a demand for zoom lenses with high relative aperture for video cameras with low sensitivity image pickup elements.
* The design of the zoom lens involves proper rules for lens units to achieve high relative aperture without increasing the F-number too much.
* Increasing the refractive power of each lens unit to reduce the size of the lens system can lead to increased aberrations.
* The invention aims to provide a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and reduced size while maintaining optical performance.
* Specific conditions must be met for the construction and arrangement of lens units to correct aberrations effectively.
* The design of the fourth and fifth lens units plays a crucial role in correcting aberrations and achieving high optical performance.
* Four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses are provided with detailed data on radii of curvature, thicknesses, refractive indices, and Abbe numbers.
* The numerical examples demonstrate the achievement of a large relative aperture, high zoom range, and reduced size while maintaining optical performance.
* The total length of the zoom lens can be significantly reduced to as short as 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A, making it suitable for photographic and video cameras.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
• The apparatus includes a stationary ring, a movable ring, a torque motor, and an electronic sensor to measure distances.
• The driven disc assembly is mounted on a splined hub and engaged between the rings for testing.
• The torque motor exerts torque on the assembly to check for warpage.
• A microprocessor controls the operation of the apparatus and generates test results.
• The program includes steps for engaging, rotating, and measuring the driven disc assembly.
• If the assembly meets tolerances, it is released, but if not, the operator is alerted.
• The apparatus provides automatic testing and external indications of the tested assembly's condition.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to face age-estimation using a contourlet appearance model.
* The technology is useful for various applications, such as age verification in businesses and security systems.
* The aging process of human faces is complex and influenced by various factors.
* Computer science approaches to face aging are relatively new compared to other fields.
* The method involves extracting facial features, mapping them to age groups, and using SVMs for classification.
* The system uses Support Vector Regression to construct aging functions for different age groups.
* The age classifier distinguishes between youths and adults based on extracted features.
* The estimated age is generated using the appropriate aging function based on the classification.
* The system can provide estimated ages with confidence factors for accuracy.
* The technology can be implemented on a computing system with various input and output devices. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, preserving the definition of the image with higher resolution.
* The device consists of a controller producing light intensity signals for each pixel and a matrix of pixels organized in arrangements.
* Each arrangement includes pixels dedicated to displaying the first image, pixels for the second image, and pixels for a combination of both images.
* Different arrangements of pixels can be used, such as squares of four pixels, with each pixel emitting a specific color.
* The controller can apply attenuation functions to adjust the light intensity signals based on predetermined thresholds, enhancing the contrast and visibility of the merged images.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a motor vehicle security system with a removable payment element for cashless transactions.
* The payment element can be inserted into a receptacle in the housing and removed by the user when needed, allowing for various payment actions.
* The closure on the housing protects the receptacle when the payment element is removed, ensuring the functionality of the identification transmitter.
* The identification transmitter can communicate with both the security system of the motor vehicle and the electronic payment system, providing convenience and security for the user.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus with multiple heads for recording and reproducing signals with high precision.
• The apparatus includes MR heads, bias current circuits, regenerative amplifiers, and decoder circuits mounted on a rotary drum.
• Control signals are generated on the stationary side and transmitted to the rotary side via rotary transformers for regulating bias currents and operating amperages of the heads.

• The apparatus allows independent regulation of bias currents for MR heads and recording heads, ensuring optimal operating points for each head.
• The control signals prioritize head switching and current control data to prevent signal loss and ensure stable data recording and reproduction.
• The invention can be applied to various recording/reproducing apparatuses with multiple heads, not limited to MR heads, for precise control and high-speed switching.
</summary>

<summary>
* An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, may become inactive and enter a sleep mode to save energy. However, the tribo charge of the toner may decrease during long periods of inactivity, affecting image quality.
* Various exemplary embodiments propose methods for charging toner in an imaging device based on periods of inactivity. These methods involve determining user usage patterns, predicting next usage cycles, measuring toner charge levels, and adjusting toner charge levels to ensure consistent image quality.
* The disclosed intelligent toner charging system includes components such as an inactivity determining section, a predicting section, a measuring section, a calculating section, an updating section, a storing section, a charging section, and a performing section to optimize toner charge levels for printing operations. These methods can be implemented in software or hardware to improve the efficiency and accuracy of toner charging in imaging devices.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network for hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The device includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the call and a bypass switch for extending the conversation.
• It can be used by individuals with limited mobility or in situations where handling a phone is difficult.
• The system can be easily connected to existing telephone systems and provides a portable, versatile, and cost-effective solution.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on optical fiber communications network design, specifically incorporating branch powered amplification.
• Optical fiber amplifiers have revolutionized undersea lightwave communications, increasing data transmission capacities significantly.
• The need for reliable undersea networks with multipoint connectivity has shifted the focus from point-to-point capacity expansion.
• The invention proposes a network design combining trunk and branch structures with ring topology for enhanced survivability.
• By utilizing remotely pumped optical amplifiers powered through branch cables, the invention reduces the need for costly undersea repeaters.
• The system includes hub assemblies, branching units, cable stations, and light emitting power sources to enable repeaterless signal amplification.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is about locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects like pipes or cables, especially when a second object is nearby.
• Two general techniques for locating buried metallic objects are passive (using a gradiometer) and active (using a transmitter and receiver).
• The invention provides a system and method for locating and tracing one object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The system includes a transmitter with two antennae inducing distinguishable currents in the objects and a receiver sensing magnetic fields associated with the currents.
• The method involves producing distinguishable currents in the objects and moving a receiver sensitive to the magnetic fields associated with the currents.
• The system uses different techniques to make the currents distinguishable and produce an output signal dependent on both currents.
• The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the objects to improve tracing accuracy.
• The output signal characteristic shows distinct nulls over each object, making it easier to locate and trace the desired object.
• Different carrier frequencies or modulation techniques are used to distinguish the currents and produce an output signal dependent on both currents.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to cover plate devices for wiring devices in ganged boxes mounted in building walls, providing a finished look without exposed fasteners.
* The cover plate device consists of two parts - an attachment member mounted to the wiring device and a cover plate member with no visible fastener holes.
* The cover plate member is designed to fit over the attachment member, with latching pawls engaging saw-tooth shaped racks for secure installation, accommodating variations in wall flatness, and allowing for easy removal using a small tool. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a system that automatically notifies a speaker to slow down their speaking rate when it exceeds a threshold that a listener can comprehend, taking into account factors like language proficiency and speech clarity.
* The system includes a device with components like a microphone, sensory mechanism, and speech processors to monitor and analyze the speaking rate, language being spoken, and listener's proficiency, providing indicators to the speaker to adjust their rate accordingly.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, such as television sets and monitors.
* The device consists of concentric annular strips that can be fixed in front of a screen and slide over each other to cover or uncover the screen.
* The strips have decreasing wall thickness, allowing for different viewing angles without hindrance.
* The strips are equipped with hook and locking elements for reliable folding and unfolding.
* An adapter member provides a flat attachment face for the device, allowing it to be fitted to various types of monitors.
* The device is compact when folded, easy to install, and cost-effective to produce.
* The invention is defined by the use of annular strips that enclose each other tightly, providing flexibility in positioning and viewing angles for the screen. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, using means for deviating and suppressing the beam to scan N lines of a picture plane cyclically.
• Conventional TV cameras have a picture sequence of 25 Hz, but high-speed cameras are expensive and film-based, limiting immediate interpretation.
• The device allows for higher picture sequence frequencies by scanning a reduced number of lines in a picture, increasing time resolution.
• A programmable counter controls the scanning, with a selectable number of count steps p to determine the scanning pattern.
• The video signals can be digitized for analysis, with the option to fill in missing lines for a complete picture.
• The device is versatile, allowing for adjustments in the counting capacity to optimize time and spatial resolution for different processes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a content synchronization framework for connected devices.
* The framework allows devices to synchronize content based on dynamic attributes and file bundles.
* Central reference point server processes synchronization requests and returns responses with bundles of files.
* Client devices create a delta list of files to download based on the response bundles.
* Files are downloaded in priority order, and incomplete bundles are rejected.
* Bundles contain file descriptions, download priorities, and actions for the client device.
* Partner servers may be involved to provide additional context for response bundles.
* The client device verifies local copies of files and downloads updated files as per the response.
* The synchronization process is adaptive, rejecting incomplete bundles and optimizing download order. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention integrates voice calls with multimedia sessions as blended calls, using a multimedia server with blender software.
• Incoming calls are directed to the blender if the recipient supports blended calling, with voice and multimedia components initiated.
• Outgoing calls from clients with blended capabilities are processed through the blender, with voice and multimedia components established.
• The blender manages signaling paths for voice and multimedia components, merging them into a single session controlled by the multimedia server.
• SIP is used for call setup and tear down, with multimedia servers handling call disposition and providing multimedia services.
• An Intelligent Network signal may be used to determine if a call is blended, integrating circuit-based and packet-based systems.
• The methodology involves separating call and multimedia requests, passing voice components back to the telephony server, and maintaining control over signaling paths.
• The process may be rearranged for concurrent or different order of steps, with improvements and modifications considered within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for communication between finders and owners of lost objects using unique IDs and virtual locales.
* Owners affix tags with unique IDs to their possessions and register them with their contact information in a centralized database.
* Finders access a website or virtual locale specified on the tag to communicate with owners anonymously.
* Owners can manage their tags and open cases through a user-friendly interface on the system.
* Finders can send one-way messages or open new cases to communicate with owners through the system.
* The system handles incoming messages from various messaging protocols and forwards them to the respective owners.
* The system ensures privacy by using anonymous email addresses and messaging handles for communication between finders and owners.
* The system can be implemented using open-source technologies and programming languages for efficient operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention discloses a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die without a wafer saw.
• The process involves forming trenches along scribe lines on the wafer, applying mechanical pressure to cause a clean break, and singulating the die.
• The method includes steps such as applying a photo resist layer, patterning, etching trenches, back-grinding the wafer, applying adhesive tape, and applying pressure to break the wafer along scribe lines.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an electron multiplier using thin foils to create secondary electrons for amplification or detection of particles.
* The foil electron multiplier design includes a series of thin foils held by foil holders in an evacuated enclosure with an anode for electron collection.
* The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by optimizing foil thickness, material selection, and applied voltage per stage.
* The foil electron multiplier design eliminates ion feedback, unlike continuous electron multipliers, by preventing ions from being accelerated back towards the entrance.
* Commercially available carbon foils are preferred for their thinness and uniformity, but other materials like silver, gold, and hydrocarbons can also be used.
* A support grid is required for thin foils to provide structural support and can be attached to the foil holder.
* The foil electron multiplier has a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers, requiring fewer stages for the same charge amplification.
* The foil electron multiplier performance was demonstrated with O+ ion beams, showing an increase in gain with applied voltage per stage.
* The foil electron multiplier design offers advantages in gain efficiency, fabrication simplicity, cost, area coverage, and rejection of ion feedback compared to conventional electron multipliers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows motion pictures to be viewed in 3D effortlessly.
* The system uses signals to synchronize lens filters to lateral motion in the motion picture, controlling the 3D visual effect for the viewer.
* Different algorithms can be used to detect motion and the direction of lateral motion in the film.
* The system uses digital photo sensors, miniature special purpose computers, and substances that change color and transparency.
* The lenses of the viewer glasses can be set to clear-clear, clear-dark, or dark-clear based on the detected synchronization events.
* The algorithm tracks intensity edges in the frames to identify lateral motion and synchronize the lenses accordingly.
* The lenses are controlled based on the presence or absence of motion and the direction of lateral movement in the motion picture.
* The system can account for head movement and adjust the lenses accordingly.
* Different lens control algorithms may be used for black and white or color motion picture media.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, allowing for recording information through an edge surface.
* The sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with highly doped bottom layer and lightly doped upper layer, forming image sensor elements.
* Charge carriers generated by light on the edge surfaces are guided towards the CCDs by P+ layers, creating a waveguide-like structure.
* The image sensor can be used to image in multiple planes, such as simultaneously imaging two opposing surfaces or passageways.
* The thickness of the upper layer is crucial for effective vertical aperture dimension in the edge surfaces of the sensor.
* A second embodiment extends the N-type regions of the CCDs to the edges, improving charge collection and reducing crosstalk.
* The image sensor can be used for color applications by placing color filters over the image sensor elements in different imaging planes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements caused by ionized gases.
* The protection structure includes reduction plates or electrodes on the cathode, deflecting ionized gases away to prevent electrical surges and burnout damage.
* Multiple reduction plates can be arranged parallel to field emission elements or in a meshwork pattern to prolong the device's lifetime.
* The reduction plates are negatively charged to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions, preventing them from reaching the cathode.
* The manufacturing process involves depositing metal layers, etching, and forming field emission elements to complete the device structure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems.
• Power management is important to reduce energy consumption in home networks.
• Current networks struggle to enter power save mode while performing administrative functions.
• The invention allows for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
• The home network includes devices like video and audio servers and systems.
• Devices can serve as both network master and slave nodes.
• The network master node performs administrative functions and controls network traffic.
• The method involves transferring administrative functions to a slave node before the master node enters power save mode.
• The slave node can accept the transfer, become the new master node, and perform administrative functions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system with a liquid-tight seal.
• Traditional subminiature lamps use adhesive to support the glass envelope within a metal sleeve, leading to degradation issues.
• The use of an internal O-ring or external O-ring has proven problematic in preventing liquid from entering the lamp.
• The new solution involves a polymeric seal support that surrounds the glass envelope and provides extended sealing, heat resistance, and ease of handling.
• The polymeric seal support eliminates the need for adhesive, allows for closer tolerance centering of the lamp components, and provides a longer seal length for better sealing.
• The seal supported lamp assembly also minimizes air volume by using potting material to backfill the cavity within the lamp base.
• Assembly involves inserting the abbreviated height base into the polymeric seal support, injecting potting material, and securing the electrical connections.
• The invention can be applied to any situation requiring insulation, high heat resistance, solvent and chemical resistance, and effective sealing.
• The patent covers all changes and modifications that may reasonably be included within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements for measuring the direction of electromagnetic radiation propagation.
• Low elevation angles are difficult to measure due to interference from ground reflections, especially at low operating frequencies.
• A unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of antenna elements was identified in a UK patent to optimize angle measurements.
• The triplet arrangement consists of at least four antennae spaced to provide linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
• Radio receiver means obtain information signals from each antenna, with amplitude and phase functions of elevation angles and ground reflection coefficient.
• Logic means combine and derive signals from antennae to provide a quotient signal independent of ground reflection coefficient.
• The array can operate in receive or transmit mode, with coherent carriers required for transmissions within triplets.
• Practical embodiments of antenna arrays arranged as triplets are shown for specific applications like monitoring aircraft height during landing.
• Circuit arrangements for measuring the quotient signal and a system for determining range, identity, and elevation angle of aircraft are illustrated.
• The antenna array can also be used for coding angles in space through radio transmissions for remote receivers to derive elevation angles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors without using an intermediate electrode.
* The panel consists of layers laminated on a glass substrate, including first and second luminescent layers that emit different colors when voltage is applied.
* By changing the driving voltage, the panel can display images in green at low luminance and in a lemon color at high luminance, which is a mixture of green and orange light.
* Different embodiments include variations such as the addition of a color filter to emit red light, thicker portions on the luminescent layer for higher luminance, and modifications to the luminescent materials used.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to precoder configuration in MIMO systems, specifically aimed at reducing computational costs.
• The GDFE Precoder is optimized for MU-MIMO wireless systems, achieving high system capacity.
• Different precoding techniques like Block Diagonalization and Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding are compared for system capacity optimization.
• The proposed method for GDFE Precoder computation reduces the need for knowledge of the "Least Favorable Noise" covariance matrix.
• The method provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder without requiring channel reduction.
• The computational cost of determining GDFE Precoder components is significantly reduced, making it suitable for practical systems. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, using a network and/or the Internet to transfer digitized speech data. It includes audio means for sound reproduction and recording, converting means for data conversion, and protocol means for handling data in accordance with TCP/IP protocol.
• The terminal also has wireless communication means for near field communication with a connecting unit to establish a network/Internet connection. It enables dynamic IP address allocation, facilitates communication between users, and provides additional functionalities like news, music, and chat rooms.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a method for fabricating a structure for semiconductor circuitry using a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on a semiconductor substrate, followed by the deposition of a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.
• The use of a germanium buffer layer between high-dielectric oxides and Si or metal reduces reactivity, enhances epitaxy, and prevents the formation of a low dielectric layer at the interface, allowing for the integration of various oxides in semiconductor structures.
</summary>

<summary>
* Receiver input circuits with preamplifier and mixer arrangements are used in radio and TV receivers.
* The invention aims to eliminate signal distortions by using multiple amplification control loops.
* The first control loop prevents overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes.
* The second control loop prevents overloading of the mixer stage and oscillator due to powerful signals.
* A third control loop with lower response threshold and bandwidth can support the other control circuits.
* The use of PIN diodes for amplification control offers advantages in protecting components and maintaining constant operating power.
* Additional embodiments include extended reactance networks, tunable selective circuits, and iteration-free alignment of tuning circuits. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and housing, specifically an axial fan with increased intake airflow rate without modifying assembly conditions with other elements.
• A conventional fan typically includes a fan housing and impeller to dissipate heat generated by electrical elements, such as a CPU, within a closed housing.
• The housing of the heat-dissipating device extends outward to enlarge intake airflow area without changing assembly conditions, enhancing heat-dissipating efficiency.
• The sidewall of the housing may extend radially outward in a symmetrical manner, increasing the dimension of the impeller blade and airflow rate.
• The air passage formed by the sidewall gradually reduces in cross-sectional area, concentrating air streams towards the center for better heat dissipation.
• The heat-dissipating device can be mounted in a system casing with electrical elements, improving heat dissipation and preventing damage due to high temperatures.
• The device can also be used with a heat sink, mounted on a CPU, to dissipate heat efficiently and guide air streams towards the central portion of the heat sink for enhanced cooling.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a system for setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals without complex setup processes.
* The system includes a telephone with a collaborate indicator and button, connected to a LAN, and a PC running collaboration applications.
* The collaborate indicator is illuminated when parties share collaboration applications, allowing for document sharing, video conferencing, etc.
* The collaborate button is used to initiate collaboration, launching or bringing collaboration applications to the foreground on both parties' PCs.
* The system can be implemented over the Internet, with variations in hardware configurations and deployment options. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to inserting advertising clips into video sequences to optimize visual impact.
* The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and advertising clips, determining similarity between them, and selecting the clip with the highest similarity.
* The selected clip is inserted at a point in the video sequence, typically corresponding to a shot change.
* A device implementing this method includes memory, processing unit, input/output interface, and man-machine interface for detecting shot changes and inserting advertising clips.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves using a recessed mask structure to prevent high electrical fields in small semiconductor devices, reducing leakage and breakdown.
• By positioning the mask below the surface to be planarized, the invention achieves lower lateral leakage current and a lower effective dielectric constant.
• The structure and process of the invention result in a lower overall capacitance, faster signal propagation, and the ability to use different materials in semiconductor devices.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages to prevent contamination of lead surfaces.
• The method involves cutting the leadframe between adjacent semiconductor dies, exposing side surfaces of the leads, and plating them with a material that does not react with oxygen.
• Different cutting techniques, such as full cutting or partial cutting with beveled blades, can be used to create straight or beveled side surfaces on the semiconductor packages.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules. Nanowires and nanotubes are used for label-free detection of biomolecule binding, and nanoimprint lithography is used to fabricate arrays of semiconducting nanotraces for multiplex detection.
* The fabrication process involves creating a template with nanoimprint features, depositing a semiconducting active layer, patterning the nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography, and synthesizing anchor probe libraries on the surface of the nanotraces. The anchor probes, such as nucleic acid sequences, are covalently attached to the nanotraces to detect specific targets.
* The detection process involves measuring changes in electrical conductivity of the nanotraces when target molecules bind to the anchor probes. The presence of a target molecule that matches the anchor probe sequence results in a change in current, indicating the identity of the target. The multiplex detection array allows for simultaneous detection of multiple targets in a single sample.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can connect to both a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local network (WLAN).
* The mobile terminal can switch between WWAN and WLAN based on signal strength and other factors to optimize communication.
* The WLAN gathers information about neighboring base stations from the WWAN, allowing the mobile terminal to skip some connection setup time when switching networks.
* The mobile terminal has two wireless modules - one for WWAN and one for WLAN - to facilitate seamless switching between networks.
* The method involves turning on the WWAN module when the signal from the WLAN drops below a certain threshold, ensuring continuous connectivity.
* If the initial connection attempt fails, the mobile terminal can scan frequency channels or perform all channel scanning to establish a connection. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down converting A/D converter, eliminating the need for complex discrete-time analog circuitry.
* By placing the sampler inside the predictive loop, the predictive filter can be implemented using DSP techniques, allowing for flexibility in reprogramming the filter characteristics to match the input signal.
* The dynamic range performance is extended by utilizing the digital output of the loop to control a variable gain amplifier placed at the front of the predictive loop input.
* An offset nuller element dynamically detects and removes offsets that would impair the analog-to-digital conversion process, enhancing the DC offset performance of the converter.
* The digital predictive filter reshapes the power spectral density of the quantized error signal, reducing quantization noise and improving dynamic range.
* The implementation example of the Downconverting Digitizer achieved over 52 dB of dynamic range, equivalent to a dual 8-bit baseband analog-to-digital converter, with the AGC loop extending the dynamic range to over 124 dB.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention simplifies the production of multilayered components by eliminating costly steps involving cutting and metallizing.
* The process involves forming electrodes and electrical components on decals, stacking them in precise registered relation, and removing the decals to form resultant assemblies.
* Multiple electrodes and components are deposited on separate decals to create laminate sub-assemblies, which are then stacked to form capacitors, coils, resistances, or combinations thereof.
* The process allows for the fabrication of various sizes of components at low cost and high production rates.
* The method also enables the interconnection of electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies and the formation of covers at the upper and lower ends of the stacks.
* The resulting assemblies can be used for a wide range of electronic ceramic devices, including capacitors, inductors, transformers, semiconductor packages, and precision resistors.
* The new process eliminates cutting stress cracks and internal delamination issues commonly found in conventional production methods.
* It also allows for the production of smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, and shapes not limited to parallelepipeds or cylinders.
* The process provides end terminations for electrodes, enabling a variety of tab configurations without additional processing time.
* Inventory can be partially carried in decal form, allowing for rapid response to customer demands and the production of capacitors suitable for use with semiconductor devices.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons by integrating an IGCC facility with a CTL facility.
• The process includes wet gasification of coal to produce combustion gas at high pressure, enriching a portion of the gas with hydrogen, and generating power from another portion of the gas.
• Additionally, dry gasification of coal produces a synthesis gas precursor, which is mixed with the hydrogen-enriched gas for hydrocarbon synthesis.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to hierarchical lattice structures with unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength.
• The lattice structures can be used as cores for sandwich panels, providing high specific stiffness and strength for various applications including transportation, blast mitigation, and thermal transfer.
• The lattice structures can be nested and mated to form balanced structures, which can then have face sheets attached to provide additional support and functionality.
• The lattice structures can be fabricated through injection molding processes, with the resulting unit cells used as templates for deposition of other materials or for investment casting.
• Various methods of manufacture, including die casting, stamping, and extrusion, can be used to create the unit cells for the lattice structures.
• The lattice structures can be curved, used for jet or rocket nozzles, or implemented in walls, floors, armor, or other structures for various applications.
• The lattice structures can be used for impact or blast energy absorption, heat exchange, catalytic support, energy storage, and other multifunctional purposes.
• The lattice structures can be made from a variety of materials, including metals, polymers, ceramics, and composites, and can be coated or deposited with additional materials for enhanced properties.
• The scope of the invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described, and various modifications, variations, and equivalents are possible within the spirit and scope of the claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, allowing for precise cutting of thin foam samples without damaging the cell structure.
• The apparatus includes a base structure, clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism to ensure uniform thickness and parallel cut edges of foam samples.
• By using the apparatus, foam samples can be prepared for detailed microscopic examination to assess cell structure, quality control, and performance criteria of foam materials. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers designed for ocean floor operation.
* It provides a method to determine the angle of inclination assumed by the seismometer.
* The invention ensures good coupling of seismic detectors to the ocean floor.
* It includes a self-leveling apparatus for seismic motion detectors.
* The apparatus preserves the orientation of the detectors for later measurement.
* The invention uses a spring-loaded plunger to lock the detectors in place.
* A solenoid is used to release the plunger and lock the detectors.
* The angle of inclination can be determined by measuring the position of the detectors.
